titleStmt.title: The hope of peace By laying open such doubts and manifest vntruthes as are divulged by the Arch-priest in his letter or answere to the bookes which were published by the priestes.
titleStmt.author: Bennett, John, fl. 1588-1623.

titleStmt.title: The hope of peace By laying open such doubts and manifest vntruthes as are divulged by the Arch-priest in his letter or answere to the bookes which were published by the priestes.
titleStmt.author: Bennett, John, fl. 1588-1623.
Blackwell, George, 1546 or 7-1613.

publicationStmt.publisher: By the heires of D. Turner [i.e. T. Creede],

notesStmt.note: Actual place of publication and printer from STC.
Includes text of George Blackwell's letter.

"One in a series of controversial Catholic works, between the Arch-priest George Blackwell and the Jesuits on the one hand, and the secular priests on the other (the "appellant)."--Folger Shakespeare Library Catalogue.
Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.

person.persName: the heires of D. Turner [i.e. T. Creede]
